The staff is friendly, helpful and very attentive to your needs.  We got there about 6:30pm and there was only one booth that was occupied.  They have several booths and tables as well as delivery and people who call in and come pick the food up.

We started with the Thai Spring Rolls and they were AMAZING!!!!  We then had the Pad Thai, the Cashew Chicken and the Green Curry which was all EXCELLENT. 

We love Thai food and have tried several places in town and this one was way above the rest.  From the service, the ambiance, the size of the place and the FOOD.

Did I mention the food was AMAZING.  We really liked this place and I encourage you to give this place a try and share your experience.
Chicken chow mein was amazing! Best Thai food so far!

via text
Chum: Hey, I'm arriving here at one, dinner? drinks? both?
Me: Both

7 pm
Chum: Where the hell are you?
Me: Downtown
Chum: Meet us at Ping Pong on Sunset

Didn't get a chance to Yelp it, but Chum and his pals liked it so I met up with them.  The place was empty except for a couple.  It was strange...they sat us in the booth right next to them.  Trixie and Antonio come here often and love it.  They also commented that every time they are here, the place is empty.  I asked what about lunch, and they said it's the same.  So a red flag went up and I now wondered if it was any good.  But then again, Chum has dated an assortment of Asian girls so maybe he had better take on this place than I gave him credit for even if he's a vegetarian.

I ordered my standard Panang curry with chicken.  Here is where it was a little strange.  This was the first time, I've ordered Thai food with people who didn't opt to share everything.  So I couldn't try Trixie's Pad Thai, although I'm sure she would have if I asked, but I had just met them, so I felt kinda weird.  My dish was very good with just the right amount of heat...I ordered it spicy #2.  I also ordered a Singha beer as well.  Price wasn't so bad...$53 for the four of us.  The portions were generous too.

Overall, it was a pleasant dining experience.  We thought that maybe this was a cover for some money laundering thing.  And what's up with the name?  Is ping pong even Thai in origin?  The staff was very nice.  I thought it was funny that the rice took a while to come out.  So I'm not sure if my review is accurate based on one dish.  But it is my favorite and it was very tasty.  

I would definitely come back and try more the next time I'm in the area.  I'm in an internet cafe because the wifi is whack at my hotel.

Drop in here for the occasional lunch special.  Everything is reasonably priced and the service is phenomenal!  I wish I could tell you more about the restaurant but I order the same thing every time I go in because I can't resist! The Spicy Basil Chicken lunch special with salad or soup with white rice on the side, is the perfect amount of food for the price.  Decent ambiance overall.  This is a must for foodies needing a quality and reasonably priced lunch in the area!

very busy place. Ordered for large group and staff was very friendly and accommodating. Left and got a call that they forgot an item so drove back and they met me outside with item. Excellent local find.
My favorite Thai Restaurant hands down! Been going there since they opened and will continue to support such a great restaurant with awesome staff and amazing food!

I always drive by Ping Pong whenever I go to Ross J's to get lunch. In my neverending quest to keep trying new places, I finally decided to give them a go. To my delight, they have Panang Curry as one of their lunch specials. That's pretty much my go-to curry choice. I went with the basic choice of chicken, but you can also get veggie, tofu, beef, pork, or upgrade to shrimp or even salmon.

The curry tasted good. I'm realizing that I'm not that picky in general. My currrent favorite Panang is Archi's, so I have to compare to that. I give the edge to Archi's for overall flavor. Both feature string beans, but Archi's Panang has a slightly better cut and texure to the string bean. Sounds silly, but I really like what string beans bring to the mix.

I'm in between three and four stars. I'll leave it at a strong three. I'm definitely adding Ping Pong to my lunch destination rotation.

So I came back here with 3 others, ordered the same dishes as i had before.  We order 3 of 4 on the spice scale (the highest number usually signifies "Thai Spice" which is too spicy for most) but it wasn't spicy enough.  Several times before, 3 of 4 was pretty hot/spicy.  I didn't ding them for that this time but ping pong Thai...I think you guys need to standardize your spice scale.  Maybe create one so all the cooks know and goes by the same standards rather than their own opinion of what 3 of 4 spicy should be.  This way, when local people like me comes to visit, we could expect our food to taste the same or relatively the same each time. 

Thanks!
I had the pad thai lunch special, and it was a fair serving that I didn't get to finish. It was very good and saucy. The service and ambiance was good. I would dine there again.

We decided to try this new Thai restaurant for lunch based on a recent review.    We each ordered Thai ice tea and shared orders of basil shrimp and spicy noodles with shrimp.  Lunch entrees include a cup of some nondescript broth that neither of us finished.  The basil shrimp lacked both basil and much in the way of vegetables or meat while the spicy noodles dish was exceptionally bland and visually unappealing.

Greetings at the door very friendly staff, fast food delivery and great menu. I kept it very safe and got a familiar dish for the first visit but given the deliciousness of the Pad Thai, I will branch out and order other things next time. The Thai tea is very tasty too. I will return. I hear that they deliver very quickly too.
Love the food and the service. One of my favorite places to eat lunch when I'm working in Vegas.

Burst of lemon grass cilantro rich flavor of authentic tom Ka soup. Pad Thai was good with rich flavor a. Spring rolls were very fresh and crispy. I really appreciate how they aren't super sweet like a lot of Thai places seem to be. The only other Thai restaurant of course besides Lotus of Siam and Archis that is good enough for me to return.
Food was good but 19.80 for a tip its not acceptable  they should not add it to your bill specially when the service it's bad!
A place to try for all Thai lovers. O overstarred it by one because prices are good n even their cheaper/ lunch menu was quiet good...

I ordered online, I can't handle anything spicy at all. Online they even have a spice level from 0-10 to choose from, I chose the 0 obviously. The food took over an hour to arrive. I ordered yellow curry and extra rice. I got the curry, and a small side of rice. The "side" of rice is a joke. I received a huge curry and tiny thing of rice, why I didn't get my normal size rice as well is strange? Anyways, I went up the street to chopsticks and got a large side of rice, came home and started to eat my food. Two bites into it my whole mouth was on fire. I am so pissed I paid $30 for food that made my throat hurt and made me sick. So I basically threw away $30 and had to drive to get rice for food I didn't even eat. I will never go back to this horrible place.

This review is for their to go service. I called in an order when I was feeling under the weather and not only was it done super quick, the pad thai lasted me three meals!

Ping Pong is conveniently located off of Sunset and close to the airport so its perfect for grabbing a late night snack on the way home.

For lunch, this is the place to be! They have super quick service and their serving sizes are awesome. I can't comment on dinner, but I'd definitely recommend this if you're looking for a yummy and cheap lunch. I'd recommend the Panang Curry,  Basil Chicken, Pad Kee Maw and Yellow Curry. Not the best Thai place in town, but it definitely does the trick when I have a craving.
I ordered the sweet and sour chicken. Delivery was fast. Food was amazing. This was my first time here and I will definitely be returning many more times.
I've been here a bunch of times. The food is always good, the service is always great.

We used a Groupon on the Groupon app and Groupon.com and saved A LOT of money which made it even better so make sure you get that before you go. We had the yellow curry, fried rice, and Singapore noodles which were all good. The portions were really nice and the service was good.

Decent food, good lunch specials. Nothing spectacular. Pad kee Mao was tasty but the Pad Thai was strange, had a bbq like quality to it. I wonder how many people, like myself.. Came here between 3 and 4 after finding out the spot across the street was closed.. Lol

My husband's been here before for lunch- so we decided to come here for dinner. Was surprised that it was quiet- maybe because it was almost 8:00pm on Friday. Loved the tom ka gai soup and the spicy catfish, and the chicken yellow curry. Ordered it as a 2 and right amount of heat. More people walked in after us, so felt more comforted that we weren't the only ones in the place. The service was great. The decor was better than I thought- most Asian restaurants are very dated and simple. Overall, will definitely be back.

The food here is one of the best Thai food restaurants in Vegas however be weary of the Groupon/ living social scandals they offer for this place. The deal sounds good and I read the fine print of the stipulations but once you get to the restaurant there are more rules that apply. We sat down and ordered our drinks, appetizer and food and told the waitress we have a living social. This is a classic tale of bait and switch. The waitress did as she was supposed to and stated she can't honor the drinks and appetizers per the manager and/or owner and of course with it being a Sunday they were not present to discuss these stipulations that were not listed in the fine print. As I've mentioned the food is really good here and have never been disappointed but the inconsistency of their daily deals marketing and their actual house rules is completely and utterly unacceptable.

Very clean dining room and bathroom. Price is affordable. Portion served matched price. As far a taste, the dishes had a moderate Thai taste to them. Nothing memorable or unique or any wow factor. I didn't like that my penang curry had more green beans than beef.

Awesome food and service. We got the Tom Ka and Crab Ragoons. The Tom Ka was delish and creamy. Crab Ragoons were good but small size for the price. The service was great, all girls that are super nice. It is an older place but it's awesome.

I love it here been coming for years, owner is really nice I know her from my former friend that had a nail salon next to the restaurant, she got me hooked on Chicken Pad Thai, the fried rice amazing! .. crab wonton super delicious, I have tried many things in the menu and I love them.. definitely I visit this restaurant about 4 times a month and is a favorite place for my daughter as well. Totally recommended staff are super nice is a family friendly place .

Food was EXTREMELY bland and our waitress was not attentive at all. Two different people came to take our order, nothing came out right and we felt as though we had inconvenienced them by being there and dining.

I just had dinner with my husband at Ping Pong and it is a hidden gem for sure! Delightful staff and delicious food! Affordable prices and generous portions! Thank you to Apple and everyone that helped us tonight! We will be coming back very soon!

This is one of the Best restaurants I have ever been to. If you like Thai food, or want to try it out. This place serves real Thai, cooked well and great service. And you get to see some lovely Thai ladies serving your table. Did I mention I think Thai women are special. Well it doesn't matter, except to me.

I've come by here a few times and it's probably one of my top favorite Thai places to eat in Vegas.

The atmosphere is great, the place is pretty quiet and not hectic, which makes for nice evening dinners. The price is on the decent side for the amount of food you get and the wait staff is fairly friendly and attentive.

My favorite dish here is the panang curry. They don't really make the food that spicy, so I order a "4" on their spice scale (1-4) for a more authentic taste. Served with your choice of brown or white rice.

The pad thai, another popular dish, is also good and comes in a good sized portion, I usually take leftovers home. I get everything with vegetables or tofu so I can't comment on how good the meat is here.

Worth a try, and it's a place I defintely will retun to in the future

There are too many great Thai places in Vegas to put up with nonsense! I found this restaurant on Eat24. Do not order delivery from this restaurant. Estimated time for delivery was 45-60 minutes....OVER and hour and a half later. I called to check the status of the order and was told they had a lot of orders and only one driver. If an establishment cannot handle the volume of orders, they need to notify the customer. When the food finally arrived, the driver was unapologetic, food was cold, and what was edible was not all that great. I can't imagine that their service and food in the restaurant is any better.

So I came here on a Friday night with my mom. Coming into the parking lot I noticed there were a lot of cars so I expected to be busy. When we got in there was a huge dinner party of maybe 25-30 people. And other customers around. There were also 3 officers, I'm thinking having their lunch. We were escorted to the back near the restrooms, which I didn't mind but it was annoying to see that huge party of people go almost like every 5 minutes.... So when it came to waiting to order that was a 15 minute wait. Mind you me and my mom are Thai, so when they came to get our order we had a few questions as to how they cook things and flavor their food. Some regions in Thailand have different levels of spice. It seemed like the waitress was in a rush and kind of rushed our order and kept looking around not answering our questions. We ordered the Yen Ta Fo, beef noodle soup, papaya salad, and seafood tom yum. We asked to not have the food sweetened too much and if they used MSG to not use too much for us. She didn't answer us as to whether to use it or not. Well we ordered our drinks Thai tea and Thai iced coffee. It took about 15 minutes for our drinks to arrive and another 10 minutes for our tom yum to get there. All the while no one came to check on us in between. Or asked if we wanted water to drink. They went to the officers that were having lunch at least 5 times asking them if they were ok, if they wanted water, so on and so forth within the 15 minutes we waited for our drinks. I feel like customers should all be treated equally. because another party has badges and uniforms on they are treated as top priority, that to me isn't good customer service. That's just my opinion. Overall food was okay, I think the food was a little sweet to my liking and I think they might have used MSG.. I'm not too sure. The service and atmosphere wasn't too great I probably would try it again but won't go out of my way to go back. Maybe order takeout.
I went here with my family from Thailand. They loved it! Out of all the Thai places we went to, this was their favorite. We loved their tom yum gai the most.

Great  service! Waitress is really nice.
Food is awesome. I made 1 mistake and asked for medium spicy and it was too spicy for me. 
My Lao GF is Very happy we found this place... the chef is Lao too!!!!
Dont go here ever... unless u want to be happy and full.

I went here for lunch today. The service was excellent from Som and Anise. We ordered from the lunch menu, and also an extra bowl of soup. Everything was good. I was impressed with the atmosphere and cleanliness. I would return and recommend this place for meals. I cannot attest to authenticity... But the food was good and the servers were very nice looking and attentive.
I came here without eating the whole day and I was not disappointed. 4.5/5 it was a little bit salty but I was satisfied. Clean and good service... No complaints.

This is the worst to go experience I have ever had. I came in and ordered beef pad Thai. Pretty simple. I then proceeded to wait 40 minutes for my order. I watched 3 tables come in, get menus, order and get their food before I finally had enough and went up and asked what was taking so long. And why did these other people who came in after I did for their food before me. 

They then tried to tell me that those people had called in their orders before coming to dine in. I HAD WATCHED THEM GET MENUS. So then they asked me what I had ordered which confirmed that they had lost or forgot my order. Then to top it all off I finally get my food and it is one of the smallest portions I have ever seen. Plus their "salad" is a small handful of lettuce with some shredded carrot. Pitiful. 

I will never eat at this place again.
Good food, hearty portions, fast service and reasonable prices. What's not to like about this place?
Chili Mint Noodle is great and so is the fried rice.  Great prices.  Big portions.

Not very impressed. It was a half hour to closing time, so maybe they just slapped mine together or something, but I got these duck rolls and they were just.....kinda fatty/greasy and they had a strange smell to them. Then I also got pad thai with salmon and the salmon was overcooked and hard....ugh no good. The pad thai, itself, was pretty good, but not $13.95 good. I spent $30 just on myself there and it TOTALLY wasn't worth it. Save yo money!

We came here on a Saturday evening and ordered 
1. Pad see ew, chicken - 10.95
2. Panang curry, beef- 10.95 
for 26

- Unpleasant welcome. Sticky door. Unfriendly greeting, but seated right away. 
- 2 girls helped us. Direct service. No congeniality. Want drinks? Order now? Here's food. More Water? Check. Boring! I get more conversation and friendliness at a McDonald's drive-thru.
- Presentation is poor. Looks like something that was poured on a buffet line. 
- Pad see ew noodle was cut short. no chinese broccoli. flavoring was very good. portion was small. 
- Panang curry was great. veggies and beef slices were good. good portion of curry but poor serving of rice. not balanced.
- Self serve to-go. 
- No bye.
- Best received to-go but don't dine in.

Food was good I love the seafood mix curry it was tasty wish they give more muscles but for the price it was very satisfying 

Also the duck curry was just as good.


The spring rolls are ok I didn't practical like it.

Tips this place give out deals on Groupon take them! 12 dollars for 20 is a steal so saving money is good thing while trying to budget your month bills and want to eat out this is great for you 

Sadly I ate all my food before taking pictures next time I will update this with pictures

Mainly I'm reviewing to comment on the prices.  I went here because it was listed with one $.  I spent $22.00 on spring rolls, a larb salad and an iced tea.  That's not one $.  

While I'm here, I will add at the food was decent.  Nothing special though.

First time eating here and it was a great experience I arrived and there were two other tables finishing up their meals as i sat down. I got there at 12:55 to meet my boyfriend for lunch. I knew what he wanted chicken Pad Sei ew 6.95 and Thai Iced tea 2.75 and i got shrimp pad thai 8.95. I ordered both dishes at 3 out of 4 spicyness which wasn't too spicy. I was thinking i should have ordered a 4/4. Both of the lunch specials came with a chicken cabbage soup which was really tasty! YUM!
The food came out minutes after i ordered it which was surprising, but then the other tables had already been served. My boyfriend didnt arrive until 1:20 so before he arrived i asked the friendly waitress if they could warm it up because i didnt realize he was going to be late and the food would come out so quickly.
I would defiantly come back again and my BF said he would come for lunch again.

The food was tremendously overpriced while the quality was mediocre at best. They not only serve very small portions is sort of expected at Thai restaurants however their food was exceedingly small. Moreover, try not to use a Groupon there because they will not only charge you the regular price but add restrictions. I bought a $40 Groupon there and was told that I needed to order an additional $30 in food... which I did. When I thought I would get out of there for around $50 it turned out to be nearly $80. Remember, the rules changed when I got in the door so BEWARE! Personally-speaking, I will not return there and I feel it was a BAIT and SWITCH. Again... BEWARE!

One of my favorite authentic Thai restaurant. 
All staff are very friendly and nice. 
Fast service. Nice atmosphere. Great food.
My favorite dish is Tom Yum noodle soup:) yummy...

Very cute restaurant and good for lunch. The servers/staff are friendly as well. Always down to support local Asian American businesses. Also, I'm happy they serve tom yum noodle soup. You'd be surprised how many times i don't see that on the menu at Thai spots.

I went in here at 9:28 pm. They close at 10. Service was HORRRIBLE. Very dismissive. This is what happened:

They tell me to sit anywhere and a second after I sit down I pick up a menu and the second after I do that a waitress who doesn't say Hello is aking me what I want. I explain that I literally just sat down, that I need a minute. She looks annoyed and says,  K. but we close soon. I said, I thought you closed at 10. And she said, Soon, please hurry. Then I have to flag her down, and I ask her a question, dismissive again. And then I order something and she marches off. No nothing. While I'm waiting the other tables leave and it's just me and they literally start cleaning around my feet and getting mops out, making me lose my appetite. No one seems to even see me. Finally, my dish is set down, and besides the fact that the waitress set it down and marched off in silence, the food was really pretty good. Thai basil with sliced beef is what I got. Anyway, the waitress didn't come back. I finished my water. Needed more. Needed to pay. Finally I flag her down and pay. My total was 12 bucks or so, and I wanted to leave no tip but I left $1. 

How horribly rude. To close at 10 and have a customer come in at 9:28 and feel rushed and cleaned around and ignored.

We have been locals since 09 and well we have passed this place many times. Seeing the 2 smiling faces on the outside sign right next to Sunset park. The location was always the reason for not dining here.

We entered to a very welcoming restaurant that was very tastefully decorated. We were surprisingly impressed. The waitresses are also the hostess and they welcomed us as we entered. Once seated our waitress quickly returned to take our drink order and order if we were ready. They came by often to refresh drinks and they worked together to make sure customers were happy. Again we were surprisingly impressed. 

Now the food. We started with the spring rolls. They were veggie and not the best but good. I prefer meat ones but wanted to try something new. Our entrees were Swimming Rama with chicken and a side of fried rice it was very well seasoned with just the right amount of spice. Now the Crab Fried Rice is a must try!! They do not scrimp on the crab and they use a sticky rice that makes it all come together. We might ask for a lil more green onion since it just hit the spot i this meal.

Oh and I love that they add lime to the water!! If you haven't tried its so much tastier than lemon. 

Overall we were happy we came and we will be back. It's a great place to try for locals.

I love this place for lunch, great food, fast service, good size portions and excellent prices.  For dinner... while the food is still great, it is too expensive for the portion size. But I am still giving them 5 stars because of their lunch specials..

My family and I decided to come here while in Vegas and in desperate need of some lunch grubbin' after church. We were happy to see that there was a Thai restaurant; I've never actually had Thai food in Vegas before, really.

Anyways, the place is pretty spacious and the decorations are pretty nice. There weren't many people in the restaurant while we were there, but we noticed there were only about 2 waitresses doing EVERYTHING.

So we order the food: I get Pad See Ew, my sister gets Pad Thai, and my other sister gets this veggie curry with peanut sauce.

Everyone was served a salad and soup before their main dishes arrived, but the salads and soups here are a joke. Such a small portion!! I mean, I finished it in one bite (literally)!

The Pad See Ew was pretty good, but also really oily. I don't think it was the best I've had, but the flavors seemed to be really good just because there was so much oil! Granted, I was hungry, so I ate everything. The Pad Thai was also pretty good. I didn't have many complaints with it, although I really disliked the curry that my other sister got. It came with a really whack peanut sauce, that seemed to solidify or something. I don't remember what it was called, but it was just not good. Ick.

In terms of service, it was slow -- obviously because there were two waitresses serving everyone in a huge restaurant (which was an odd concept to me). There weren't even a lot of people, but the waitresses still took a long time to give us water, food, tea, and.. everything. They really need to hire more people during busier hours. Or were they not expecting a bigger turnout?

Anyways, the food's pretty good. I wouldn't mind coming here again, really, but they just need to amp up the service.

I like Ping Pong Thai. Seriously. As someone who frequents Thai places, this is one of the best that isn't downtown, on the strip, or overpriced. 

Lets cut to the chase - this place is in a strip mall on Sunset. It's unassuming. And you will drive right past it if you aren't paying attention. The place is clean and the staff are friendly and attentive - as long as you aren't there during their personal lunch breaks (come on now - everyone needs a break).

I have personally ordered the Thai Basil Chicken, Tom Kha Gai soup, Beef Jerky, Panang Curry Chicken, and Pad Thai. I absolutely LOVE the Thai Basil and Tom Kha Gai soup. The ingredients are fresh and the dishes are spicy (if that is how you like them). Be sure to check their spice levels! I have had one server state the levels were from 1-10, and another stated 0-5. One tip: They do not skimp on the spices, so if you do not like spicy, stick with a 0-1!

Because this place is a local's favorite, I would suggest a late lunch or early dinner (think between 2:30 - 5:30) to beat the rush. Sometimes the place is empty, and sometimes it is standing room only!

Enjoy!

We dined here because we found a deal on Groupon. The service was so so and the food was the same. The server had a hard time speaking English. We ordered the veggie pan fired noddles and veggie fried rice. Not sure I will be back
Very good. I ordered delivery to my hotel. Arrived pretty quick. Panang curry was solid. Thai tea was very good as well. I'll be ordering again.

Oh my goodness, what can I say about the food except it was delicious. The portion size was just right. Spicy seafood fried rice was good. Papaya salad was delicious reminded me of my bestfriend who made it for me on a weekly basis. Tom yum kha was amazing just the right spices. I will go back again if I am back in Las Vegas.

It's a very good Thai restaurant fresh food, great flavor. Sukiyaki soup and papaya salad was awesome. Crab fried rice and garlic shrimps, we're perfect.
Service was a bit slow and too casual for my taste.

I've been coming here randomly for almost 2 years. Yesterday I wanted something completely different from the regular dishes I order, which are the Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, Pork Fried Rice, Duck Wrap, and Spring Rolls. I normally won't eat mushrooms. But I wanted a soup and couldn't take my eyes off the Tom Ga Kai. When I got home, not only did I eat every mushroom but the entire container was gone and I stared at the bottom thinking why didn't I buy the big container? So I'm awake now and ordering up another one!

This is my first review and I want to review about thai food cuz i'm thai lol.Yesterday I went to this restaurant with my boyfriend. We had papaya salad to start and 2 meals basil with seafood and beef noodle soup. We enjoyed our food an service was soo good. There are cute waitresses. If you wanna try authentic Thai u should u go there.

Outstanding Thai menu...and unlike most Thai restaurants these days, they actually give you enough food...so much, in fact that you can have another entire delicious meal out of your leftovers! The best part eating there is they aren't stingy with the rice, either. They will gladly offer you extra to go with their unbelievably good curry dishes or any other plate that comes with rice. Very impressed with this place, food was outstanding! I've been driving by it for years, and the outside looks a little strange for a Thai restaurant, but don't be discouraged by that!
Fall is here ..I Love Tom Yum Noodle Soup at Ping Pong Thai with Extra Spicy ..Reminded of my home ..Thailand !!

Love the Yum tom soup , very delicious. I also liked the chow mein and the pineapple fried rice with a side of a Thai Tea , I ordered delivery. Maybe one day ill stop by and actually go inside the restaurant to dine in.
fantastic thai food at a reasonable price. worth a visit! if you like sweet tea, try the Thai ice tea.

My favorite Thai restaurant, in fact, we don't like to go anywhere else!  I drive from Summerlin area to Henderson to get my Thai fix, that's how much I love this place,

Pad Thai - scrumptious, perfect blend of sweet and savory, not oily or dry
Panang curry - love the mixture of coconut and curry

You won't go wrong with this Thai choice.

Ping Pong Thai offers very fresh food served with smiles. We enjoyed the Panang Curry which we poured on to fragrant combination fried rice. The rice had four huge, succulent prawns along with tender beef and chicken to go with ample vegetables. The spring rolls were crispy and flaky, not greasy, and the papaya salad was really balanced; however, be careful to order it very mild (1 on their 1-4 scale) as they use fresh Thai chilis that give off an intense heat.

This is a great little family-owned Thai place!  We ordered over the phone so often that they recognized us by our order (and once they even stayed open 15 minutes later just for our take-out order...great customer service!).  Their pad-thai was delicious just about every time I've had it...but once I wasn't pleased with it and I told them that it just didn't taste right.  They were very polite about it and gave me my next order of pad-thai for free :)  Their yellow curry is also savory and yummy. This place never disappoints :)

I love that the place looks and feels so cozy, yet feels modern because of the music playing. Staff are warm, asking nicely if you need anything, constantly refilling drinks too. We ordered fried spring rolls (3 pcs then cut to halves) and chicken satay for the appetizer. The chicken satay is so juicy yet thinly cut which is beautiful! For our entreé we ordered beef pannang which comes with plain rice, beef pad see ew and shrimp fried rice; all of these with spiciness level 2. Food are cooked well, presented well and are in generous proportions (good for two).

This place's lunch special (ends at 4pm daily) is AMAZING! It comes with either a soup or salad (soup is great) and the main course of your choice. All entrees comes with a generous portion that is guaranteed to at least fill you up. Today, I had their Pad Thai salmon. You get your Pad Thai and a big piece of salmon on top. It is perfectly cooked and the salmon will flake to pieces! Love this place and love how convenient of a location this place is located at! Highly recommended!
Best for quick lunch. Well established typical Thai menu. Great service. My favorite is panang beef is average comparing to other places I have been.

I usually don't review, but this place is actually authentic and delicious. Hope to see them around for a long time. best and personally my favorite Pad Thai in Vegas! Rather go here than Lotus to Siam any day of the week.

This place is awesome. Food was excellent!! Our waitress was Apple and Pai these lovely ladies were soooo nice and very friendly! Btw the duck here is awesome!!! I had a groupon but over all this place is worth every bite. Mkst def coming here again!!
